page.title: 03FOOTPATH - RURAL WILTSHIRE
page.content: All footpaths are numbered on definitive maps of Local Highway Authority. The main path is the Ridgeway Path, which is a completely walkable section of a long_distance path; so designated to distinguish it from the original{Ridgeway,}which goes across Smeathes Ridge up to the Downs. This is a flat walk on roadways; uninteresting with no views. The Chiseldon 44, Liddington 14 and Aldbourne 16 are all one path and link Ridgeway road to Ridgeway Long Distance Path. Chiseldon Footpaths Association walk it regularly. The Aldbourne Green continues as the Liddington 15 and is walked but verges on ploughed fields. Liddington 16 goes by old flint pits. Wanborough 1 crosses Liddington 16 and is partly ploughed over. Aldbourne 14,from Lower Upham to Upper Upham, is walkable.
